content.text:
# Feature Enhancements

ElizaOS has received numerous feature enhancements in recent updates:

- Added default logger level setting capability (PR #2451)
- Created version.cmd for Windows support (PR #2442)
- Enhanced the Solana Agent Kit with new features (PR #2458)
- Added tests for Instagram client (PR #2454)
- Integrated Pyth Data Plugin (PR #2434)
- Updated Heurist environment variable examples (PR #2428)
- Added contributor meeting notes for 2025-01-14 (PR #2426)
- Implemented workflow to block minified JS (PR #2417)
- Improved logging functionality (PR #2396)
- Added Code In Plugin to load characters from blockchain (PR #2371)
- Enabled IBC transfers on Cosmos blockchains (PR #2358)
- Enhanced Telegram autonomous agent with extra multimedia support (PR #2338, #2510)
- Integrated Coinbase AgentKit plugin (PR #2298)
- Added Livepeer LLM provider integration (PR #2154)
- Implemented Injective plugin (PR #1764)
- Added support for loading multiple characters from a single remote URL (PR #2475)
- Added test configuration for Binance plugin (PR #2482)
- Enhanced Sui to support secp256k1/secp256r1 algorithms (PR #2476)
- Improved Discord autonomous agent (PR #2335)
- Introduced Dependency Injection to enhance developer experience (PR #2115)

# Bug Fixes

Several bugs have been addressed in recent updates:

- Fixed incorrect Tweet ID parameter passed to sendTweet function (PR #2430)
- Fixed OPENAI provider being overwritten by LLAMA_LOCAL on pnpm start (PR #2465)
- Resolved type error for children in animated.div component (PR #2462)
- Fixed various typos and spelling errors in documentation and characters (PR #2464, #2456, #2449, #2447)
- Updated error message and removed duplicate version field (PR #2445)
- Fixed missing import issue (PR #2444)
- Updated Zero Gravity (0G) link (PR #2441)
- Fixed quickstart.md conflicts (PR #2437)
- Corrected typos in Supabase seed file (PR #2435)
- Implemented default port 3000 when VITE_SERVER_PORT is not defined (PR #2433)
- Fixed TEE Log plugin errors at agent startup (PR #2415)
- Fixed conditional use of useQuery in AgentRoute component (PR #2413)
- Fixed image description issue (PR #2375)
- Fixed SwapAction in evm-plugin (PR #2332)
- Fixed linting errors (PR #2474)

# Testing and Documentation

Improvements to testing and documentation include:

- Added test configuration and tests for Redis adapter (PR #2470)
- Added tests for Supabase and SQLite DB adapters (PR #2468)
- Updated handling of test cases in version.sh file (PR #2485)
- Updated documentation links (PR #2438, #2495)
- Added OpenAI environment to smoke tests (PR #2472)
- Reverted "dockerize smoke tests" (PR #2459)

# Other Changes

Other notable changes include:

- Set OpenAI as the default character provider (PR #2460)
- Removed Tate character (PR #2425)
- Replaced ESLint, Prettier, and TSLint with Biome (PR #2439)
- Updated createToken.ts (PR #2493)
- Corrected banner links in multiple PRs (PR #2491, #2490, #2489, #2483)

categories.title: ElizaOS and AI Agent Development Updates

content.text: ElizaOS has had a productive week with significant developments across multiple platforms including polygon, fleek, arbitrum, and more. The project has attracted over 400 contributors and hosted successful livestreams with 14,000+ viewers and weekly spaces reaching 10,000+ listeners. The AI agent DegenAI has begun trading and tweeting autonomously.

The team is working on several upcoming initiatives including retro funding for contributors, autonomous trader improvements, more v2 streams, a website for degenspartanai, and enhancements to AI news show and newsletters. They're focusing on scaling their operations and staying on top of developments.

Shaw, the developer behind Eliza, has been building agent frameworks for years. The current goal is to create an AI agent-led fund that evolves into an AI agent-led DAO, with automation at the center and humans at the edges. Other AI agents in the DAO are currently functioning like interns, learning different operations and roles.

Progress is being made on automating DAO communications by aggregating updates from Github, Twitter, and Discord. This data, combined with market news, will be used to generate daily and weekly content. The team is also working on adding sources to verify news and streamlining graphics for display.

The Eliza leaderboard is being developed as a way to communicate daily repository updates and focus areas of each contributor, though it's still a work in progress. The team is also planning to create an Eliza agent connected to all relevant DAO data sources to provide instant answers from documentation, GitHub updates, and contributor activities.

Shaw is currently working on inventory functionality for Eliza v2, considering it a better term than 'wallet'. He's also contemplating adding CLI features next. The AI agent is already trading autonomously, though Shaw notes 'he's kind of a dick about it' when asked about his holdings.

categories.title: Recent GitHub Issues in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several technical issues have been reported in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub repository, covering a range of problems across different platforms and functionalities:

1. Connection and timeout issues:
   - Anthropic 504 Timeout (Issue #2414)
   - MacOS Eliza Client connection problems, cycling between "Connecting" and "Disconnected" states (Issue #2471)

2. Installation and compatibility problems:
   - Docker container issues on M-based Mac, with missing module '@anush008/tokenizers-linux-arm64-gnu' (Issue #2432)
   - WSL 2 onnxruntime package errors (Issue #2478)
   - Error when using <QueryClientProvider /> component (Issue #2416)

3. Feature and documentation requests:
   - Request for documentation on the implemented RagKnowledge feature (Issue #2484)
   - Suggestion for Twitter bot improvements to make agents interact more naturally in Twitter Spaces (Issue #2488)

4. Bug reports:
   - Unexpected JSON metadata appearing in Twitter bot replies (Issue #2423)
   - The database/index.ts file not utilizing the CACHE_STORE environment variable (Issue #2511)

5. Testing improvements:
   - Request to add timeout test coverage for the Binance plugin price service (Issue #2486)

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the Eliza Repository

content.text:
Several significant pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository, focusing on new features, bug fixes, and code improvements:

- A new Pyth Data Plugin has been added (PR #2434)
- A fix for the OPENAI provider being overwritten by LLAMA_LOCAL on pnpm start (PR #2465)
- Documentation improvements for plugins (PR #2419)
- Code quality improvements with the replacement of eslint, prettier, and tslint with biome (PR #2439)
- Introduction of Dependency Injection to enhance developer experience (PR #2115)
- Enhanced multimedia support for the Telegram client (PR #1837)
- Test configuration and coverage for the Binance plugin (PR #2482)
- Additional development work in PR #2443 (Platinum dev no148)

The elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity over a two-day period. From January 17-18, 2025, there were 45 new pull requests with 37 merged, 16 new issues created, and 73 active contributors. Activity decreased slightly on the following day (January 18-19, 2025) with 27 new pull requests (20 merged), 9 new issues, and 42 active contributors. Overall, the project maintained strong development momentum with consistent contributions throughout the weekend.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the contributors to the elizaOS/eliza project.
